page.title: 01Downs East Of Tidworth
page.content: The western half of this block is Defence Department land; the remainder private farm land. To the north lies Perham Down Barracks, the home of an Engineer Regiment with its housing for married officers and soldiers. To the south is the rifle ranges, two ranges with 16 targets, 600 metres long and ne small range for smaller weapons. The danger area of the ranges is in part managed woodlands, the rest being farmed by a tenant farmer from Home Farm, Tidworth. The private farmland is owed by three farmers and a farming company. Crops grown are wheat, barley, peas, beans, oil-seed rape, and grass for seed and animal grazing and conservation. There is a 150 cow dairy with the cows housed in winter, a very large pig unit in mobile huts with pigs being fattened indoors also beef cattle and
